includes: Order: C++ std headers, then JUCE headers, then project headers
Use forward declarations in headers when possible
Include full headers only in .cpp files

inheritance.virtualDestructor: Always declare virtual destructor for base classes
inheritance.override: Always use 'override' keyword for virtual function overrides
inheritance.final: Use 'final' when class should not be inherited

classDesign.ruleOfFive: Implement or delete: copy ctor, copy assign, move ctor, move assign, destructor
classDesign.constCorrectness: Mark member functions const when they don't modify state

smartPointers.shared_ptr: Only when shared ownership is truly needed
smartPointers.raw: For non-owning references (use reference or pointer)

modernCpp.autoKeyword: Use 'auto' for complex types, explicit types for clarity
modernCpp.rangeBasedFor: Prefer range-based for loops: for (const auto& item : container)
modernCpp.nullptr: Use nullptr instead of NULL or 0
modernCpp.enum: Use enum class instead of plain enum

comments.header: Brief description of class purpose and usage
comments.public: Document public API functions with /** Doxygen style */
comments.complex: Explain WHY for complex algorithms, not WHAT

documentation.example: /** Sets the cutoff frequency in Hz. Range: 20-4000 Hz. */

formatting.braces: Opening brace on same line for functions and classes
formatting.spacing: Space after control keywords: if (), for (), while ()

bestPractices.initialization: Use member initializer lists in constructors
bestPractices.casting: Use C++ casts: static_cast, dynamic_cast, reinterpret_cast
bestPractices.comparisons: Put constant on left in comparisons: if (0 == value)
bestPractices.assertions: Use jassert() for debugging, check release builds separately
